alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 9:15AM PDT until September 10 at 1:15PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1114 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 1114 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. entering the lower Coachella Valley from the Salton Sea. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Indio, Coachella, Thermal, La Quinta, Mecca and Santa Rosa Mountain. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
